Tip of the Month

Keep Your Website ADA Compliant

You likely have seen the recent case concerning website accessibility for blind or visually impaired persons. We have worked hard here at Justia to make sure your site (either website or blog) is ADA compliant. While there is no official standard on which tools confirm your site is compliant, we have used two tools to check and make sure that your site is ADA compliant.

If you are going to be updating your website or blog content yourself, you need to be careful not to input any codes or other HTML that may cause your site to no longer comply with ADA. As always, you are welcome to send us any changes or content you'd like to add to your website and we will ensure that when added it meets ADA standards.

Tech News

In Flashpoint for the Rebellion Against Big Tech, Sonos Sues Google for Patent Infringement

Smart audio company Sonos has filed a lawsuit against Google alleging infringement of patented technology Sonos had shared with Google in an attempt to collaborate.

Two iPhones or the Privacy of Billions: Why Apple vs. the FBI Matters

Apple continues to refuse the FBI’s requests to unlock the iPhones of a deceased Saudi national accused of fatally shooting three people at a Florida naval base in December.

Inside the Billion-Dollar Battle Over .Org

Ethos Capital, a private equity firm, announced its intent to buy the “.org” top-level domain, sparking backlash.

How the Police Use Facial Recognition, and Where It Falls Short

A facial-recognition system used by police in Florida exemplifies the potential risks and rewards of such technologies in law enforcement.

SEO News

Google Rolling Out Desktop Search Redesign With Black “Ad” Label, Favicons for Organic Results

Google’s recent redesign of mobile search results (including a new black "Ad" label and favicons by the URLs) is now rolling out to desktop search results as well.

Google Handles Reconsideration Requests in Batches

Google confirms that it handles in batches requests for review of your site after you fix problems identified in a manual action or security issues notification.

YouTube’s Organic Visibility Tops Wikipedia in Google SERPs

YouTube recently overtook Wikipedia for the #1 spot in organic search, highlighting the importance of optimizing videos for search.

Google Ads Introduces Bid Simulator Support for Smart Bidding

Google Ads has announced it is rolling out support for a bid simulator, as well as a new budget simulator.

Adding video to your site can provide potential clients with additional legal information and insights into your practice and firm. It may be the difference in a client's choice in hiring you!

Social Media News

Facebook Accused of Shutting Out Mobile Competitors in Lawsuit

Mobile app developers have filed a class-action lawsuit against Facebook alleging that the company revoked access to data in an attempt to stifle competition.

LinkedIn Brings 3 New Features to LinkedIn Pages

LinkedIn pages are gaining three new features: the ability to invite first-degree profile connections to follow, the ability to stream with LinkedIn Live, and the option to post as an individual or an organization.

Facebook is Banning Deepfake Videos

Facebook announced this month that it would ban "deepfakes", which are AI-manipulated videos that distort reality, and other heavily manipulated media.

Facebook is Preparing to Launch a Desktop Redesign to All Users

Facebook is reportedly planning to roll out a redesign of its desktop website to all users before this spring.

Inside Justia

Meet Our Team

Super Bowl Sunday

We wore our red, gold & white to cheer on the San Francisco 49ers in the Super Bowl last weekend. Congrats to the Kansas City Chiefs on their victory!

A Pug’s Tale

Rest in Peace, Rio Bravo

Last month we had to say goodbye to Hug Pug Rio Bravo. He was loving, fun, smart, and brought joy to all of his Justia peeps. With his tender and compassionate soul, he also served as a therapy dog visiting nursing homes. We are lucky to have had him in our lives and will miss him so much.

Legal Industry News

New Survey Finds No. 1 Reason Why Partners Leave Their Firms -- And It’s Not the Most Obvious One

According to a new survey, the top reason partners leave their law firms is lack of confidence in firm management and strategy.

Justices Should Consider When Wrongfully Convicted Can Seek Damages, ABA Says

The ABA filed an amicus brief with the Supreme Court arguing the Court should clarify its rule as to when an individual who was wrongfully convicted may seek damages.

Tech Company Accused of Bar-Exam Grading Glitch Has No Liability in Test-Takers’ Suit, 11th Circuit Says

The Eleventh Circuit held that Georgia bar takers who were erroneously told they had failed the bar exam cannot recover damages against the software company that allegedly produced the incorrect scores.

James Sandman, Innovative LSC Leader and Legal Tech Advocate, to Step Down

James Sandman, president of the Legal Services Corporation and advocate of the use of technology to enhance access to justice, announced he is stepping down.
